revision.comment: Voxfax moved page [[Talk:Artúr Görgey]] to [[Talk:Artúr Görgei]]: his self changed surname
revision.text:

It contains appropriate supporting materials, such as an infobox, images, or diagrams. --> |B-Class-5=yes |Biography-task-force=yes }} {{WikiProject Hungary|class=start|importance=}} }}
==Spelling?== Isn't it spelled "Görgey"? [[User:Alensha|Alensha]] 23:52, 17 Apr 2005 (UTC)
Absolutely! Moreover, his first name is written as "Artúr" today. Page moved, name replaced everywhere. --[[User:Adam78|Adam78]] 13:10, 29 Apr 2005 (UTC)
::Actually, he changed the spelling from Görgey to Görgei during the revolution (the former being too "aristocratic" for a revolutionary leader - the ending "y" usually indicates that the holder of the name is (was) a nobleman). The reason for using the form "Görgey" is that he did not oppose this when the first edition of his memoirs was published in 1911, under the name "Görgey Artúr". [[User:Vay|Vay]] 23:50, 8 January 2006 (UTC)
Kosáry wrote that, Görgey had never applied for changing his name. Vince Muntag
== Other aspects of his life should be added ==
He was not only a military leader, but a professor in chemistry, and he was the first, who succeeded isolating an industrially important organic acid. [[Special:Contributions/84.2.192.236|84.2.192.236]] ([[User talk:84.2.192.236|talk]]) 08:43, 22 May 2010 (UTC)
